extendedIngredients.name: bacon strips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 pound bacon strips, cooked and crumbled

extendedIngredients.name: oysters
extendedIngredients.originalString: 30 fresh oysters in the shell, washed

extendedIngredients.name: spinach
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipes.title: Deb's Oysters Rockefeller

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Luna Nuda Pinot Grigio. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Luna Nuda Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light green lustres run through the radiant straw-yellow color of this wine, whose aroma is rich in fruits, the most striking of which are pears and apples. An excellent balance gives this wine strength and structure. It is dry and smooth on the palate with a pleasant, mineral aftertaste.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Shuck oysters, reserving bottom shell; set aside. Spread rock salt into two ungreased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pans. Lightly press the oyster shells down into the salt. Place one oyster in each shell; top each with spinach, bacon and cheese.                                                                                           Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 14-16 minutes or until oysters are plump. Meanwhile, prepare hollandaise sauce according to package directions. Drizzle over oysters and serve immediately.                                        Yield: 2-1/2 dozen.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Deb's Oysters Rockefeller in  Taste of Home Christmas AnnualAnnual 2012, p9                                                                                                                                                                                                         Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 appetizer equals 46 calories, 3 g fat (2 g saturated fat), 12 mg cholesterol, 114 mg sodium, 2 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 2 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Shuck oysters, reserving bottom shell; set aside.
Spread rock salt into two ungreased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pans. Lightly press the oyster shells down into the salt.
Place one oyster in each shell; top each with spinach, bacon and cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 14-16 minutes or until oysters are plump. Meanwhile, prepare hollandaise sauce according to package directions.
Drizzle over oysters and serve immediately.
